info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bladen, Robeson and northern Columbus Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Maxton to near Howellsville to near Ammon. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Elizabethtown, Red Springs, Rowan, Pembroke, Fairmont, Maxton, St. Pauls, Bladenboro, Rowland, Sandyfield, Boardman, Rex, Ammon, Hestertown, Shannon, White Oak, Carvers, Smiths and Howellsville. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
